intro: Hymenoxys scaposa var. argyrocaulon, commonly known as the silverleaf hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs, which provide insulation and reflect sunlight. The silverleaf hymenoxys is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
